pub.citation: Hoot, S.B., Kadereit, J.W., Blatiner, F.R., Jork, K.B., Schwarzbach, A.E., P.R. Crane 1997 Data Congruence and Phylogeny of the Papaveraceae s.l. Based on Four Data Sets: atpB and rbcL Sequences, trnK Restriction Sites, and Morphological Characters Systematic Botany, 22(3): pp. 575-590

pmmd.notes: Phylogenetic analysis of Papaveraceae s.l and selected outgroup taxa based on combined atpB and rbcL sequence data. Illicium was used to root the tree. Numbers above lines indicate the number of nucleotide changes supporting each branch. Numbers below the branches are the percentage of times that the branch was recovered in 1,000 bootstrap replications. Genera in Papaveraceae s. str. are indicated in bold. Acronyms after brackets are families and subfamilies designated by Liden (1993a & b) and Kadereit et al. (1994): Pter. = Pteridophyllaceae, Fuma. = Fumariaceae, Esch. =Eschscholzioideae, Papa. =Papaveroideae, Plat. =Platystemonoideae, Chel. = Chelidonioideae+Glaucium/ Dicranostigma.
